intro: Spiraea yatabei, commonly known as the Japanese spiraea, is a deciduous shrub native to Japan. It features slender, arching stems that produce clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers in early summer. The plant has finely cut, ovate leaves that turn yellow in the fall. It thrives in partial to full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for garden landscapes. Spiraea yatabei is valued for its ornamental appeal and hardiness in temperate climates.
